meanings.definition: To clear the throat loudly in a disapproving or irritated manner.
meanings.sent1: Grandpa harumphed before giving his opinion on the noisy music.
meanings.sent2: She harumphed when her brother refused to help with the chores.
meanings.sent3: The cat harumphed at the closed door, wanting to go outside.
meanings.sent4: The old car harumphed as it struggled up the steep hill.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's harumph echoed in the silent classroom, signaling the start of the lesson.

meanings.definition: To express dissatisfaction or annoyance in a gruff or abrupt manner.
meanings.sent1: The customer harumphed at the long wait in line at the store.
meanings.sent2: He harumphed and crossed his arms when his idea was dismissed.
meanings.sent3: The toddler harumphed when told it was bedtime, not ready to sleep.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds harumphed ominously in the distance.
meanings.sent5: The disgruntled employee harumphed as he left the meeting, frustrated with the lack of progress.
